skill.name: baseline-ui
skill.description: Enforces an opinionated UI baseline to prevent AI-generated interface slop.
skill.summary: Enforces quality UI standards including Tailwind CSS, accessible components, performance guidelines, and design constraints.
skill.author: ibelick

security_audit.summary: All 54 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The scanner misinterpreted Markdown documentation syntax (backtick characters) as Ruby shell commands and UI terminology as security threats. This skill is pure documentation with no executable code, network requests, or security risks.

risk_factor_evidence.description: Scanner misinterpreted backtick characters in Markdown code blocks as Ruby shell backtick execution. No actual external commands exist.
The only URL is a documentation reference to base-ui.com. No network requests are made by this skill.

medium_findings.confidence_reasoning: SKILL.md is pure Markdown documentation. Backticks mark inline code and code blocks. No executable code exists in this skill.

low_findings.confidence_reasoning: Lines reference CSS animation guidelines for 'background' (paint property) and 'images' (UI elements), not system reconnaissance.

content.value_statement: AI-generated interfaces often lack consistency and accessibility. This skill enforces opinionated UI standards for Tailwind CSS, accessible components, performance best practices, and design constraints.
actual_capabilities: Enforces Tailwind CSS defaults and utility patterns
Validates accessible component primitives from Base UI, React Aria, or Radix
Reviews animation performance by restricting compositor-only properties
Checks typography standards including text-balance and tabular-nums
Verifies layout constraints like fixed z-index scales and safe-area-insets
Validates interaction patterns including error placement and accessible dialogs
limitations: Does not execute code or modify files directly
Does not integrate with design systems beyond the documented constraints
Does not provide visual previews or rendered output
Assumes existing project has Tailwind CSS and compatible component libraries

use_cases.title: Front-End Developer Review
use_cases.description: Use /baseline-ui to review React components against established quality standards before committing code.
use_cases.target_user: Front-end developers building React applications with Tailwind CSS

use_cases.title: AI Assistant Guidelines
use_cases.description: Configure AI assistants to follow consistent UI patterns when generating interface code.
use_cases.target_user: Engineering teams using Claude or Codex for code generation

use_cases.title: Design System Documentation
use_cases.description: Establish and enforce team-wide UI standards for React component development.
use_cases.target_user: Engineering managers and design system maintainers

prompt_templates.title: Quick Constraint Check
prompt_templates.prompt:
/baseline-ui

Review all UI code in this conversation against the baseline constraints. Report any violations with the exact line, why it matters, and a concrete fix.
prompt_templates.scenario: Quick check of generated UI code

prompt_templates.title: Component Review
prompt_templates.prompt:
/baseline-ui <file>

Apply the baseline constraints to this file. For each violation provide: the exact code snippet, one sentence explaining the impact, and a specific code-level suggestion.

prompt_templates.title: Animation Audit
prompt_templates.prompt:
Review the following React components for animation violations:
- Are only compositor props animated?
- Are layout properties avoided?
- Does animation respect reduced-motion preferences?

Identify any issues and suggest fixes.

prompt_templates.title: Accessibility Validation
prompt_templates.prompt:
Check these components for accessibility compliance:
- Icon-only buttons have aria-labels?
- AlertDialog is used for destructive actions?
- Error messages appear near their inputs?
- Keyboard and focus behavior uses primitives?

output: Why it matters: `h-screen` causes layout issues on mobile browsers with dynamic toolbars
Fix: Replace with `h-dvh` for dynamic viewport height
Why it matters: Layout property changes trigger reflow, causing janky animations
Fix: Use `transform: scaleX()` instead with origin-aligned transform
Button.tsx - Accessibility Violation: Icon-only button lacks aria-label
Impact: Screen readers cannot announce the button purpose
Fix: Add `aria-label="Edit settings"` to the button element
Button.tsx - Animation Violation: Button has custom letter-spacing
Impact: Modifying tracking breaks visual rhythm and accessibility
Fix: Remove `tracking-wide` unless explicitly requested by design

best_practices: Use the /baseline-ui command at the start of UI-focused conversations to establish constraints upfront
Run /baseline-ui before submitting PRs that include React component changes
Combine with component library documentation to ensure compatibility with Base UI, React Aria, or Radix primitives
anti_patterns: Ignoring animation constraints that trigger layout reflow, causing janky user experiences
Mixing primitive systems (Base UI + Radix) within the same interaction surface
Using arbitrary z-index values instead of a documented scale

faq.question: Does this skill modify my code files?
faq.answer: No. The skill only reviews code and provides recommendations. You must apply fixes manually.

faq.question: Which CSS frameworks are supported?
faq.answer: The skill is designed for Tailwind CSS. It can be adapted to other utility-first frameworks with custom configuration.

faq.question: What React component libraries work best?
faq.answer: Base UI, React Aria, and Radix Primitives are officially supported. The skill requires accessible primitives for keyboard and focus behavior.

faq.question: Can I skip constraints for specific components?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill can be invoked selectively. Document exceptions in code comments for team clarity.

faq.question: Does this work with Next.js or other frameworks?
faq.answer: Yes. The constraints are framework-agnostic. Only the animation guidelines depend on React and framer-motion.

faq.question: How do I add custom constraints?
faq.answer: Fork the skill and modify SKILL.md. Your team can maintain a private version with additional rules.
